Class RideRequestDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cmput301w20t10.uberapp.database.base.DAOBase<RideRequestEntity,RideRequest>
      • com.cmput301w20t10.uberapp.database.RideRequestDAO

  • public class RideRequestDAO
extends DAOBase<RideRequestEntity,RideRequest>
    Data Access Object (DAO) for RideRequestEntity model. DAO contains specific operations that are concerned with the model they are associated with.
    Author:
    Allan Manuba

      • createRideRequest

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<RideRequest> createRideRequest(@NonNull
                                                                         Rider rider,
                                                                         Route route,
                                                                         int fareOffer,
                                                                         androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner owner)
        Create a ride request
        Parameters:
        rider -
        route -
        fareOffer -
        Returns:
        Returns a MutableLiveData object. To observe a MutableLiveData object: 
              DatabaseManager db = DatabaseManager.getInstance();
      DAO dao = db.getDAO();
      MutableLiveData liveData = dao.getModel(...);
      liveData.observe(this, model -> {
          // receive model inside here
      });
        When observed, the object may receive model as the following:
        • Non-null RideRequestEntity object: the RideRequestEntity object's fields were successfully added to the database.
          Null: Registration failed.

      • saveModel

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<java.lang.Boolean> saveModel(RideRequest rideRequest)
        Description copied from class: DAOBase
        Saves all dirty fields for a given model. Dirty fields in an entity are unsaved fields. DatabaseObjectBase detects these changes. This is the method that's encouraged to use to update your models. To update your models: 

             Rider rider;

     ...
     // code that changes your rider such as
     rider.setImage("new image");
     ...

     MutableLiveData liveData = RiderDAO.getDAO();
     liveData.observe(lifecycleOwner, riderDAO -> {
         if (riderDAO != null) {
              // it is recommended that you keep your riderDAO as a local variable
              // once you have verified that riderDAO is null
              riderDAO.saveModel(rider)
                  .observe(...);
         } else {
              // error handling here
              // it is likely that the user was not logged in
              // or the user was logged out by the system
         }
     });
        Specified by:
        saveModel in class DAOBase<RideRequestEntity,RideRequest>
        Parameters:
        rideRequest - Model to update
        Returns:
        MutableLiveData that views can observe to know whether saving was successful or not

      • getAllActiveRideRequest

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<java.util.List<RideRequest>> getAllActiveRideRequest(Driver driver)
        Sends an empty list knowing there's an internet connection. For every subsequent update, the list increases in size. During these updates, when we lose connection, we get null instead of a list. The updates stop as soon as the list in the database is exhausted or when we lose connection i.e. we receive a null object instead of a list
        Parameters:
        driver -
        Returns:
        List or null
